The mysterious death of Annamalai University student Udayakumar 54 years ago
description: In July 1971, a controversy was triggered by Annamalai University conferring the honorary degree of Doctor of Letters upon then Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi. The sad aspect of the row was the death of K.P. Udayakumar, a third-year student of B.Sc. (Maths), under circumstances that have remained a mystery to date.

Small plane crash-lands on Florida freeway; hits car - watch video
description: A small plane made a dramatic emergency landing on a Florida freeway Monday evening, impacting a car. The aircraft, experiencing engine trouble, touched down on Interstate-95 in Merritt Island, striking a Toyota Camry. Miraculously, the two men aboard the plane escaped unharmed, while the Camry's driver sustained minor injuries.

title: U.S. revokes 85,000 visas since January as Trump administration tightens immigration rules
description: The announcement was accompanied by an image of Trump with the words “Make America Safe Again,” reinforcing administration’s stance that stricter visa regulations are vital for national security

description: I could not help reflecting on how much of a valuable record cinema is when it comes to capturing heritage for posterity. And at the same time, it also highlights what we have lost

Tirumala dupatta scam: Those ‘silk’ may just be plain polyester; TTD flags decade-long fraud
description: In a shocking turn of events, the Tirumala temple trust claims a massive fraud involving silk dupattas. For the past ten years, a company allegedly supplied synthetic polyester under the guise of luxurious mulberry silk.

title: ‘Dhurandhar’ Day 5: Ranveer–Akshaye film grows, hits Rs 150cr India, Rs 220cr worldwide
description: Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna's 'Dhurandhar' is a box office sensation, crossing Rs 100 crore in its opening weekend and showing remarkable weekday strength. The spy thriller's impressive collections, nearing Rs 153 crore domestically, have propelled it into Ranveer's top-grossing films. Worldwide, it has already amassed over Rs 224 crore.

description: The fourth edition of CIBF will be held from January 16 to January 18, 2026 at Kalaivanar Arangam in Chennai

2027 WC: Afridi slams Gambhir, says 'Virat & Rohit are backbone of Indian batting'
description: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi supports Indian stars Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. He believes they are crucial for India's plans and should continue until the 2027 ODI World Cup. Afridi suggests resting them against weaker teams. He also commented on coach Gautam Gambhir's approach. Afridi expressed happiness over Rohit Sharma breaking his six-hitting record.

title: IND vs SA: Not Kapil, Shami or Zaheer - Bumrah becomes first Indian to achieve this feat
description: Jasprit Bumrah achieved a remarkable feat in the first T20I against South Africa, becoming the first Indian bowler to claim 100 wickets in all three international formats. He reached this milestone by dismissing Dewald Brevis and Keshav Maharaj, adding to his impressive international tally. India secured a dominant 101-run victory in the match.

title: IPL Auction: 'Lot of attitude' - KKR coach opens up on released player
description: Venkatesh Iyer, released by KKR, enters the IPL 2026 mini-auction with a Rs 2 crore base price. Head coach Abhishek Nayar revealed Iyer's attitude and willingness to face adversity, not just his numbers, were key factors in his selection. Nayar highlighted Iyer's self-belief and conviction during trials as standout qualities.

title: Likes, dislikes and ignorance
FIFA President Gianni Infantino accused of ethics breach: Report
description: Center to the complaint is Infantino’s effusive praise of United States President Donald Trump, as well as world soccer’s governing body bestowing a first-of-its-kind FIFA Peace Prize on Trump.

title: Goa authorities trashed own report on violations by club
description: Goa authorities allegedly ignored a report detailing "gross violations" at a property where a fatal nightclub fire occurred, dropping proceedings against the owner. Meanwhile, in Delhi, agencies are passing the buck over a vanished wetland, with the Municipal Corporation of Delhi and Central Pollution Control Board blaming each other for its disappearance under landfill waste.

description: The tour will be played across the three formats: classical, rapid and blitz. But the classical format has been reduced to a shorter time control of 45 minutes, though.

title: Three arrested 3 days after beating DTC driver to death in Delhi
107 oppn MPs submit notice to remove Madras HC judge over lamp-lighting order
description: Over 100 opposition MPs have submitted a notice to the Lok Sabha Speaker seeking the removal of Madras High Court Justice GR Swaminathan. They accuse him of misconduct and bias in a recent order concerning a lamp lighting at a temple near a dargah in Tamil Nadu.

title: Subansiri Lower project: To fund hydel project, NHPC proposed its forest land assets as collateral, Govt said no
EC can't determine voter's citizenship, but surely inquire into it: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court clarified that while the Election Commission cannot definitively determine citizenship, it can inquire about it if doubts arise regarding voters.  The apex court emphasized that Indian citizenship is a constitutional prerequisite for voting, not merely a matter of residence and age. This ruling supports the EC's stance on verifying voter eligibility.

title: BlackRock unit agrees to invest ₹3,000 crore in Aditya Birla Renewables for minority stake
description: The GIP investment translates into an enterprise value of ₹ 14,600 crore for ABREN.

title: Liverpool defy Salah crisis by beating Inter Milan in Champions League
description: Dominik Szoboszlai's late penalty gave the Reds a huge win at the San Siro in the absence of Egypt star Salah, who was left in England after publicly criticising manager Arne Slot at the weekend

title: Kids as young as 11 dabbling in drugs, shows 10-city survey
description: A nationwide school survey reveals alarming drug experimentation among Indian children, with initiation as early as 11 and an average age of 12.9.  One in seven students has tried psychoactive substances, with opioids and cannabis prevalent. Experts warn of easy access and emotional distress driving this trend, urging early intervention and parental vigilance.

title: Committee to Protect Journalists writes to PM Modi, urges him to address the matter of jailed journalists
description: Noting that India is a signatory to the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, the non-profit press freedom organisation said it was incumbent upon the government to “uphold its international and domestic human rights obligations”.

title: MBA graduate snatches mobile phones in Dwarka to make quick buck, held

HC rejects higher alimony plea of wife divorced from husband over ‘onion-garlic dispute’

description: He charged that the current administration had behaved in a manner “far harsher than what our freedom fighters could have imagined from an independent Indian government.”

title: Fifty years ago | Delhi superbazar as model institution
Surat health worker dies in honeybee attack, wife injured
71st Sawai Gandharva Bhimsen Mahotsav begins today: On hallowed stage, several debut artistes this time
DGCA slashes IndiGo flights by 5%, govt doubles it to 10%
description: The government has doubled IndiGo's flight cuts to 10% following operational failures and crew norm non-compliance. This punitive action aims to stabilize the airline's services and reduce passenger disruptions. IndiGo's CEO was summoned to explain the mismanagement, with further reviews planned. Other airlines saw minor adjustments to their winter schedules.

title: Oppn belittling 'Vande Mataram' by linking it to Bengal polls: Amit Shah in Rajya Sabha
description: Home Minister Amit Shah asserted that the Congress's decision to divide Vande Mataram in 1937, as a concession to the Muslim League, initiated appeasement politics that ultimately led to India's partition. He emphasized the song's role in cultural nationalism and slammed the opposition for belittling its significance.

title: ‘Girls are being cheated’: Patidar group demands stricter marriage registration rules, meets Dy CM
62 percent gig workers have no formal contract with platforms they work for: Study
Pro-Muslim parties opposing clean-up of rolls: BJP
description: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey countered Rahul Gandhi's electoral malpractice claims, stating EVMs were introduced by Rajiv Gandhi to curb irregularities. He linked Congress and regional parties' opposition to Special Intensive Revision (SIR) to "pro-Muslim" politics, citing population growth in West Bengal. Dubey also accused Congress of past "vote chori" and influencing poll body appointments.

title: Today’s Horoscope, December 10: Detailed Predictions for Aries, Sagittarius, Virgo, Aquarius, Taurus & More
Delhi HC directs continued treatment for 6-year-old mauled by pitbull, seeks action-taken report from police
description: Justice Sachin Datta took note of the fact that previous complaints had been made regarding the same pitbull, but no action was taken.

title: A hundred years ago | Indian tea
Sparks fly over 'vote chori', SIR in Lok Sabha poll reforms debate
description: Rahul Gandhi accused the BJP of capturing the Election Commission, alleging it colludes with the ruling party to win polls and commits "vote chori." He criticized the government's move to exclude the Chief Justice from the EC selection panel, giving the PM complete control.

title: 'Will definitely sack IndiGo CEO if it comes to that': Civil aviation minister Naidu
description: Civil Aviation Minister K Ram Mohan Naidu has apologized for the IndiGo passenger disruptions and vowed strict action, potentially including the CEO's removal. The probe will scrutinize the airline's operations and the Directorate General of Civil Aviation's (DGCA) oversight.  The minister acknowledged passenger distress, including exorbitant surge pricing, and assured accountability.

title: AAP makes fun of Rekha Gupta over 'AQI as temperature' gaffe; BJP responds
description: Delhiites want to ask these 'AAP' leaders that if they are ridiculing the Chief Minister over one small error, then they should first respond to the serious mistakes made by Arvind Kejriwal in the past years as CM, says Delhi BJP spokesperson Praveen Shankar Kapoor

title: Uncertainty looms over winter travel as IndiGo is set to cut 200-400 flights daily
description: Holiday travel plans for countless domestic flyers face disruption as IndiGo slashes 200-400 flights daily.  This significant capacity cut by India's largest airline is creating a sharp demand-supply gap, making new bookings difficult and potentially leading to cancellations for existing Yuletide travel.  Other airlines are operating at maximum capacity, unable to fill the void quickly.

title: CBI books Anil Ambani's son in bank fraud case, searches house
description: CBI has registered an FIR against Jai Anmol Ambani in a Rs 228 crore bank fraud case linked to Reliance Housing Finance. Searches were conducted at his residence. The agency is investigating allegations of cheating and criminal conspiracy causing wrongful loss to Union Bank of India. A second FIR targets RCFL and its officials for a Rs 57.

title: Same number of ATP Challengers, but different prize pools
description: As per the revised ATP calendar released on December 4, the 2026 season for the second tier of men’s tennis will open in Bengaluru on January 5. The event will offer 125 ranking points and more prize money ($225,000) this time.

title: FIH Junior Men’s Hockey World Cup | Despite structural challenges, a gritty Spain eyes its maiden title
description: Puig attributed the lack of consistency to Spain’s hockey ecosystem which remains constrained by finances.

title: Return to ballot papers, expand collegium that picks ECs: Opposition
description: The Congress-led coalition of opposition parties is making strong demands for the reinstatement of ballot papers alongside a transformed collegium responsible for appointing election commissioners. Their criticisms target the Election Commission, claiming it has lost credibility, especially regarding electoral roll updates and those pesky model code infringements.

title: NDA to Opposition: How come EVMs function fine when you win?
description: Key NDA allies JDU and TDP slammed the opposition for 'double standards' on EVMs, questioning why machines are deemed faulty only after electoral losses. Shiv Sena (Shinde) pushed for lowering the voting age to 18, advocating for remote voting for migrants and simultaneous polls. Allies emphasized voter maturity and dismissed manipulation claims.

title: India, France & UAE to kick off air drill today
description: India, France, and the UAE are conducting a significant air combat exercise over the Arabian Sea to bolster trilateral defense cooperation and interoperability. The Indian Air Force is deploying advanced fighter jets and support aircraft, while France and the UAE will participate with their own Rafale and Mirage fleets.

title: Explain exemption for Assam voters from providing citizenship proof, SC tells EC
description: The Supreme Court has directed the Election Commission to explain why Assam voters were exempted from providing documentary proof during electoral roll revision, a requirement elsewhere.  This exemption, despite concerns about illegal migrants, has been questioned. Separately, the court ruled that voting rights for persecuted minorities under the CAA can only be considered after citizenship is granted.

title: No deaths due to air pollution, Centre tells Rajya Sabha
description: Health effects of air pollution are a synergistic manifestation of factors which include food habits, occupational habits, socio-economic status, medical history, immunity, heredity, etc. of the individuals, says Minister of State for Health Prataprao Jadhav

title: Mamata demands apology from PM over ‘Bankim da’ remarks
description: Participating in a discussion in Lok Sabha on 150 years of Vande Mataram, Prime Minister  Narendra Modi on Monday referred to the writer of the national song  Vande Mataram as “Bamkim da”

title: ‘Track them down’: Punjab BJP chief demands probe into drug money trail
No scope for fire-safety lapses: Gupta; MCD initiates compliance survey
description: Inspection of major events, commercial spaces vital to avert Goa-like tragedy: CM; asks Chief Secretary, fire dept. officials to review current mechanism, frame new guidelines if necessary; civic body panel chair seeks compliance report in five days

title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy reaffirms his refusal to cede land to Russia as he rallies European support
Release goats into forest to curb leopard attacks: Maharashtra Forest Minister
Trump's rice tariffs threat unlikely to have severe impact on exports
description: US President Trump's threat of new rice tariffs is unlikely to significantly impact India, as exports to the US are a small fraction of global sales and already face high duties. Experts suggest this is a negotiation tactic amid ongoing trade deal talks, with India aiming to lift existing US tariffs.

title: Threats to BLOs during SIR unacceptable: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has mandated all states to provide robust security for booth-level officers during voter enumeration, warning of severe action against any threats or obstructions. The court emphasized that non-cooperation with the Election Commission's work is a serious matter, extending beyond West Bengal to all states, and stressed the need for BLOs' safety to prevent anarchy.

title: CM vows to hand over 7,400 EWS flats in Bhalswa to slum dwellers
Zelenskyy says ready to hold Ukraine elections
description: U.S. President Donald Trump is pressuring Kyiv to accept a deal formulated by Washington, the initial version of which was criticised by Ukraine's allies as overly favourable to Russia

title: Gabrielle Union says Dwyane Wade’s mom and sister first had issues with her
description: Gabrielle Union revealed Dwyane Wade's family, particularly his sister, initially questioned her intentions due to their age difference and her childless status. The couple also navigated the fallout from Wade fathering a child with another woman during a 2013 separation. Despite these challenges, their love prevailed, leading to their 2014 marriage.

title: PM Modi-led committee, also including Rahul, meets today to pick next CIC
description: A crucial meeting is scheduled for Wednesday afternoon, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and opposition leader in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi set to select the next Chief Information Commissioner and other Information Commissioners. The Central Information Commission has been operating with a significantly reduced staff since September, with eight commissioner posts vacant. This selection process is vital for the functioning of the CIC.

title: EC officials organise SIR camps to assist sex workers in Kolkata
300 wards notified for GHMC, seven days for claims and objections
description: In the notification, all the 300 election wards along with the boundaries have been mentioned

title: A deep cleaning of India’s electoral rolls
description: The revision and verification of electoral rolls is a routine and necessary process. Such corrections do not, by themselves, imply disenfranchisement or targeting

title: Hyderabad airport gets two more hoax bomb threats
Fadnavis loses cool over repeated mention of Ladki Bahin scheme
After Putin, PM Modi to host German chancellor Merz
description: India is boosting its European ties, with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz set to visit New Delhi soon. This engagement follows President Putin's visit and precedes the India-EU summit. Discussions will focus on trade, technology, and sustainable development, building on existing partnerships. Germany's support for Ukraine and shared concerns over the Indo-Pacific will also be key topics.

title: CM Revanth to visit Osmania University on Dec.10
description: The visit carries symbolic weight, coinciding with the 16th anniversary of the announcement to carve out Telangana as a separate State, on December 9, 2009

title: Honduran leader alleges interference in vote tally
description: The final votes are still being counted after the November 30 election, with Trump-backed conservative candidate Nasry Asfura holding a slim lead.

Cam Newton’s children: Inside his family, baby mothers and all nine kids
description: Cam Newton's family size often sparks online curiosity, with the former NFL star now a father of nine. He embraces all children, including those from previous relationships, as his own, famously stating he doesn't believe in 'stepkids.' This inclusive approach to fatherhood explains his large, blended family, a topic that consistently resurfaces in public discussions.

title: Hamas calls for more international pressure on Israel before ceasefire's next phase
description: Husam Badran, a member of Hamas' political wing, called for the “full implementation of all the terms of the first phase” before moving forward, including an end to what he called the continuing demolition of Palestinian homes in the majority of the territory still controlled by Israel.

title: Anthony Richardson injury update: Colts reveal QB’s status for Seahawks game
description: Indianapolis Colts star Anthony Richardson is still recovering from an eye injury. Head coach Shane Steichen confirmed Richardson will not play this week. The player is resting his orbital bone fracture. Doctors and trainers must clear him for activation. The Colts face challenges with other player injuries and recent losses.

title: Five women injured in car accident; two critical; driver held
Andy Roddick & Brooklyn Decker 2025 net worth: Career, family and business
description: Tennis star Andy Roddick and actress-model Brooklyn Decker boast a combined net worth of $80 million in 2025. Roddick's lucrative tennis career and smart investments, alongside Decker's successful modeling and acting ventures, have built their impressive fortune. The couple, now raising two children in North Carolina, also actively supports charitable causes.

description: Speakers appreciate the State’s initiative in bringing out roadmap for growth

Goa nightclub fire: Romeo Lane’s Vagator structure demolished; razed twice, rebuilt illegally both times
description: Days after a fatal fire, authorities demolished an allegedly illegal restaurant-cum-nightclub structure at Vagator's Romeo Lane. This marks the third partial demolition of the structure in six months, with the tourism department citing repeated unauthorized reconstruction despite previous actions and a Bombay High Court directive.

Trey Benson injury update: Insider hints at setback as Cardinals stay quiet
description: Arizona Cardinals' star player Trey Benson faces a critical deadline for his return after a meniscus injury. NFL insider Adam Schefter suggests his season could end if not activated this week. Coach Jonathan Gannon remains uncertain about his comeback, leaving fans anxious as the struggling team faces the Houston Texans.

title: NIA arrests another J&K doctor in Delhi car blast case
description: A doctor from Baramulla has been arrested as the eighth suspect in the November 10 Delhi car blast, which claimed 15 lives. The NIA identified him as a co-conspirator who allegedly provided support to the suicide bomber. This arrest is part of a larger investigation into a Jaish-e-Mohammed terror module involving professionals.

J&K directs govt medical colleges to increase MBBS intake
description: Jammu and Kashmir government has directed all five government medical colleges to increase MBBS seats, with Baramulla, Doda, and Kathua receiving 50 additional seats each, and Srinagar and Jammu adding 20 each. Principals are also urged to apply for more seats and strengthen super-specialty care, with SKIMS planning to seek around 130 postgraduate and 50 undergraduate seats.

description: Mental health care must be radically reimagined as the primary pursuit of dignity and disability justice that gives importance to equity, inclusion and diversity

PIO nurse sentenced to jail in UK for raping and assaulting colleagues in care home
description: An Indian-origin nurse, Naijil Paul, has been sentenced to over seven years in jail in Scotland for raping a colleague and sexually assaulting two others. Paul fled to India before his 2019 trial but was extradited after six years. He pleaded guilty to the charges, which occurred in 2018 while he managed Acorn Park Care Home in Glasgow.

description: Rahul Gandhi delivered a blistering speech in the Lok Sabha during the election reforms debate, accusing the government and the Election Commission of institutional capture, raising concerns over “vote chori,” and questioning changes to key electoral laws. He also criticised the RSS, celebrated India’s democratic spirit, and proposed urgent reforms to protect free and fair elections.

title: PNB bank scam: Belgium court rejects Choksi's plea; 'extradition to begin soon'
description: Belgium's Supreme Court has rejected Mehul Choksi's final appeal, allowing his extradition to India to proceed. The Antwerp Court of Appeal's earlier decision, clearing his extradition for the PNB fraud case, now stands. Choksi's claims of political motivation and forced removal were dismissed, with assurances of his welfare in Indian custody.

I have already ordered notice in the contempt petition. It is beyond dispute that the order of this court has been breached repeatedly,” says Justice G.R. Swaminathan

title: Hardik Pandya powers India to 101-run rout, SA bowled out for lowest T20I score ever
description: India began their T20 World Cup 2026 preparations with a dominant 101-run victory over South Africa. Hardik Pandya starred with an all-round performance. India's bowlers were disciplined, restricting South Africa to their lowest T20I total. The win gives India a 1-0 lead in the series. The next match is in New Chandigarh.

IndiGo crisis: Govt doubles flight cuts to 10%; airline to submit revised schedule
description: Aviation authorities have slashed IndiGo's winter flight schedule by 10% following widespread passenger disruptions. The airline, which previously faced a 5% cut, will now operate significantly fewer flights due to internal mismanagement of crew rosters and inadequate communication. This move aims to stabilize operations and reduce cancellations, with IndiGo submitting a revised schedule soon.

Technology company CEOs caught smuggling Nvidia GPUs worth $160m to China
description: US authorities have busted a major smuggling ring exporting over $160 million in advanced Nvidia AI chips to China. Operation Gatekeeper revealed a scheme using fake documents and shell companies. Executives face charges for illegally shipping high-end GPUs, crucial for AI and potentially military use, to restricted destinations. Several arrests and guilty pleas have been made.

Sam Altman says industry is wrong on OpenAI's competition, it is not from Google, but ...
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has declared Apple its ultimate rival, shifting focus from AGI to device-centric AI.  A 'code red' memo halts moonshot projects to boost ChatGPT's performance, driven by aggressive talent raids from Apple.  Meanwhile, Google's Gemini surges, forcing OpenAI to prioritize mass-market appeal and user feedback to regain dominance.

Colon Cancer: Doctor explains how silent polyps grow and why screening matters
description: Colorectal cancer often begins as silent, benign polyps within the colon. These growths, initially small and undetectable, can enlarge over time, causing symptoms like abdominal pain and bleeding. Early detection through colonoscopies allows for the removal of these polyps, preventing them from developing into cancer and offering a highly successful, minimally invasive treatment.

title: Ayesha Curry admits feeling anger when women try to pursue Stephen Curry
description: Ayesha Curry revealed on 'Red Table Talk' that she sometimes feels the urge to confront women who approach her husband, Stephen Curry, due to his naturally friendly demeanor. She later expressed regret about her appearance on the show, attributing the backlash to the platform's chaotic nature and the misinterpretation of her words.

title: Inside George Springer’s fairytale life with his wife Charlise Castro
description: Charlise Castro, a former Division I softball standout and America East Player of the Year, forged her own path beyond being George Springer's wife. After excelling in athletics, she pursued an MBA and built a credible career in wellness coaching, demonstrating ambition and resilience. Her journey highlights how partners of elite athletes can cultivate independent identities and success.

title: Anna Kournikova & Enrique Iglesias 2025 net worth: Career, music and business
description: Tennis star Anna Kournikova and music icon Enrique Iglesias boast a combined net worth of $160 million in 2025. While Kournikova's fame transcended her $4 million prize money through lucrative endorsements, Iglesias' wealth stems from over 130 million record sales and global tours. Both have strategically invested in Miami real estate, contributing to their substantial shared fortune.

title: After $70bn loss, Zuckerberg signals his biggest bet is 'not working'
description: Meta is reportedly planning significant budget cuts for its Metaverse division, potentially slashing its Reality Labs budget by up to 30%. This move comes after the company has incurred over $70 billion in losses from its metaverse ambitions. The decision reflects a broader lack of consumer interest and a strategic pivot towards artificial intelligence.

title: Mike Tyson explains $40K monthly cannabis use and why family urged him to resume smoking
description: Mike Tyson revealed on a podcast that his family urged him to resume smoking cannabis after a brief five-day break, as his intense, unmedicated demeanor frightened them.  He explained that marijuana helps him manage his mood, maintain calm, and feel more like himself, contrasting it with the negative effects of alcohol.
